abstracts.cdata!:
The Kenya Agricultural Productivity
            Project (KAPP) aims to contribute to the revitalization of
            agriculture. The project has four components: 1)
            Facilitation o f Sector policy and Institutional Reforms:
            Subcomponent 1.1 supports a number o f KAPP coordinating
            bodies; and Subcomponent 1.2: Supports the National Reform
            Process;    2) Support to Extension System Reforms:
            Sub-component 2.1 supports facilitation of consultations for
            extension reform, and sub-component 2.2 supports learning
            pilots and capacity building.  3) Support to Research System
            Reforms:  Sub-component 3.1 supports facilitation of a
            consultative process for the establishment of a National
            Agriculture Research System (NARS), and sub-component 3.2
            funds support to the Kenya Agricultural Research Institute
            (KARI).  4) Support to Farmer/client Empowerment:
            Sub-component 4.1 finances institutions for farmer
            organization and empowerment, and sub-component 4.2 supports
            targeted interventions for client empowerment.   The overall
            project takes a three pronged approach to reform: policy
            dialogue and stakeholder consultation, capacity building,
            and piloting.
